question.title: Question #1
question.label: Reflect. What do you currently know about how different wavelengths of light are used to learn about astronomical objects?

content: Have you ever wondered how astronomers learn about objects in the Universe if they canâ€™t visit them in person? Nearly everything we know about the stars and galaxies in the Universe comes from the light we receive from these objects. Fortunately, that light contains a wealth of information. In this investigation, you will learn how astronomers use light and filters to investigate stars and galaxies.
